channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HADOOP-16174] Disable wildfly logs to the console
item.description:
We experience that the wildfly log

Mar 06, 2019 4:33:53 PM org.wildfly.openssl.SSL init
INFO: WFOPENSSL0002 OpenSSL Version OpenSSL 1.0.2g  1 Mar 2016

(sometimes) appears on the console but it should never. Note: this is a consequence of HADOOP-15851.
Our analysis shows the reason is that 

java.util.logging.Logger.getLogger()

is not guaranteed to always return the same logger instance so SSLSocketFactoryEx may set log level on different logger object than the one used by wildfly-openssl (https://github.com/wildfly/wildfly-openssl/blob/ace72ba07d0c746b6eb46635f4a8b122846c47c8/java/src/main/java/org/wildfly/openssl/SSL.java#L196).
From javadoc of java.util.logging.Logger.getLogger:

'Note: The LogManager may only retain a weak reference to the newly created Logger. It is important to understand that a previously created Logger with the given name may be garbage collected at any time if there is no strong reference to the Logger. In particular, this means that two back-to-back calls like{{getLogger("MyLogger").log(...)}} may use different Logger objects named "MyLogger" if there is no strong reference to the Logger named "MyLogger" elsewhere in the program.'
item.summary: Disable wildfly logs to the console

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Please see our resolution proposal uploaded as HADOOP-16174-001.patch. We also tested it, keeping a strong reference to the logger ensures that wildfly will use the very same logger object.

Hi vishwajeet.dusane,
We are wondering if setting log level in 'case Default' branch is enough or it should also be done in 'case OpenSSL' branch?
Thanks.
Another description of the problem...

-1 overall

-1

that's not going to create a reference which lasts outside the { } clause; the compiler will treat it exactly the same as before

if you want to preserve a ref, it'll have to be in a static variable or something

Hi stevel@apache.org,
Thanks for checking. It was intentional. Keeping the strong reference only until the end of the { } clause is enough for wildfly.openssl.SSL to eventually get the same logger object by ctx.init(). From that point onwards wildfly.openssl.SSL will keep that reference in its own static field (https://github.com/wildfly/wildfly-openssl/blob/ace72ba07d0c746b6eb46635f4a8b122846c47c8/java/src/main/java/org/wildfly/openssl/SSL.java#L39).

We do not want to preserve the ref outside of the switch case. Using a hard ref to the logger keeps the object in memory while we reach SSL.java:196 which is enough for us. We used local variable because we won't need that logger anymore so the scope is kept as small as possible.

Another question is that should we set the log level back to INFO. Currently there is no other logger message in SSL.java but setting back seems better and seems a complete workaround excluding any possible side effect in the future. denes.gerencser?

vishwajeet.dusane, Denes' question seems reasonable. Why only one branch is protected?

Test executed: manual jar (hadoop-azure-*.jar) replacement on an ABFS cluster:

Before patch:

hdfs dfs -ls /
Mar 07, 2019 1:02:16 PM org.wildfly.openssl.SSL init
INFO: WFOPENSSL0002 OpenSSL Version OpenSSL 1.0.2g 1 Mar 2016
Found 18 items
drwxrwxrwx - root root 0 2019-03-05 13:06 /HdiSamples
drwxrwxrwx - root root 0 2019-03-05 12:59 /ams
drwxrwxrwx - root root 0 2019-03-05 12:59 /amshbase
drwxrwxrwx - root root 0 2019-03-05 12:59 /app-logs
drwxrwxrwx - root root 0 2019-03-05 12:59 /apps
drwxrwxrwx - root root 0 2019-03-05 12:59 /atshistory
drwxrwxrwx - root root 0 2019-03-05 13:02 /atsv2
drwxrwxrwx - root root 0 2019-03-05 13:05 /example
drwxrwxrwx - root root 0 2019-03-05 12:59 /hbase
drwxrwxrwx - root root 0 2019-03-05 12:59 /hdp
drwxrwxrwx - root root 0 2019-03-05 12:59 /hive
drwxrwxrwx - root root 0 2019-03-05 12:59 /mapred
drwxrwxrwx - root root 0 2019-03-05 13:05 /mapreducestaging
drwxrwxrwx - root root 0 2019-03-05 12:59 /mr-history
drwxrwxrwx - root root 0 2019-03-05 13:05 /tezstaging
drwxrwxrwx - root root 0 2019-03-05 13:00 /tmp
drwxrwxrwx - root root 0 2019-03-05 13:00 /user
drwxrwxrwx - root root 0 2019-03-05 13:00 /warehouse

After patch:

hdfs dfs -ls /
Found 18 items
drwxrwxrwx - root root 0 2019-03-05 13:06 /HdiSamples
drwxrwxrwx - root root 0 2019-03-05 12:59 /ams
drwxrwxrwx - root root 0 2019-03-05 12:59 /amshbase
drwxrwxrwx - root root 0 2019-03-05 12:59 /app-logs
drwxrwxrwx - root root 0 2019-03-05 12:59 /apps
drwxrwxrwx - root root 0 2019-03-05 12:59 /atshistory
drwxrwxrwx - root root 0 2019-03-05 13:02 /atsv2
drwxrwxrwx - root root 0 2019-03-05 13:05 /example
drwxrwxrwx - root root 0 2019-03-05 12:59 /hbase
drwxrwxrwx - root root 0 2019-03-05 12:59 /hdp
drwxrwxrwx - root root 0 2019-03-05 12:59 /hive
drwxrwxrwx - root root 0 2019-03-05 12:59 /mapred
drwxrwxrwx - root root 0 2019-03-05 13:05 /mapreducestaging
drwxrwxrwx - root root 0 2019-03-05 12:59 /mr-history
drwxrwxrwx - root root 0 2019-03-05 13:05 /tezstaging
drwxrwxrwx - root root 0 2019-03-05 13:00 /tmp
drwxrwxrwx - root root 0 2019-03-05 13:00 /user
drwxrwxrwx - root root 0 2019-03-05 13:00 /warehouse

We do not want to preserve the ref outside of the switch case. Using a hard ref to the logger keeps the object in memory while we reach SSL.java:196 which is enough for us

I am not convinced the compiler will bother retaining a reference for the duration of the switch, given there is only one reference in the limited scope. I'm happy to be wrong, but even if I am, the javac team retains the right to optimise things like that away. And you are at risk of someone editing the code in future, as the reasoning here is not obvious

Reinstating the log to info afterwards will guarantee that the reference is retained, and stop anyone cleaning up the code from unintentionally removing the reference. Add a comment to the clause to explain the problem too. thanks

I am not convinced the...

We had exactly the same doubt but our tests on a live azure cluster showed that only one reference is enough. But basically I agree, there is no clear documentation about how javac handles this situation and what does "active reference" mean. Also indeed, it's not obvious why don't clean that code. So there are some risks.

Reinstating the log to info afterwards will guarantee that the reference is retained, and stop anyone cleaning up the code from unintentionally removing the reference. Add a comment to the clause to explain the problem too.

I agree. Setting back to INFO along with a short comment solves all the concerns. Let's do this. Thanks.

Uploaded HADOOP-16174.002.patch with reinstating logger to INFO.
Retested on live Azure cluster.
Thanks.

-1 overall

applied to 3.3 only; this doesn't apply to branch-3.2, which seemingly doesn't have HADOOP-15851 in after all. Do you want both the original patch and this one in branch-3.2? Seems good to me

Thank you stevel@apache.org.
Let me get back on this.

There is no need from our side to have it on branch-3.2.
Thank you Steve.
